result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:05 PM (64-06) Defendant Billy R. Emery appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jacob Hilton in court for Billy R. Emery.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin ADA Herrmann in court. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Attorney Hilton acknowledged Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of his client.

Adj. 3:11PM
Status conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Billy R. Emery in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Jacob Hilton in court for Billy R. Emery. Attorney has not been able to get to the jail to review complaint with defendant. Rights given and preliminary hearing requested within time period. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Billy R. Emery appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Grace Hagerman in court for Billy R. Emery. State Public Defender needs more time to appoint. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Comply with all conditions of probation. Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH M.M.S. dob 4-18-1983. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 
22-4306 thru 4309

Defendant Billy R Emery in court, in custody by video. JJ Crawford appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jason Daane appeared specially. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Defendant is on P.O. hold. Signature bond set. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
